title: Joe Carlisle
text:
Joe Carlisle (born 4 December 1987) is an <a href="England">English</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for <a href="Rotherham%20Titans">Rotherham Titans</a> in <a href="National%20League%202%20North">National League 2 North</a>.
Joe is a <a href="Worcester%20Warriors">Worcester Warriors</a> Academy product who made his league debut for Warriors in 2008 before appearing off the bench in the European Challenge Cup final against <a href="Bath%20Rugby">Bath Rugby</a> at Kingsholm his mother is called Louise carlisle
The Swindon-born player enjoyed a most successful season at Sixways during the 2010/11 campaign, racking-up thirty-three appearances and 212 points.
The points-tally included a stunning twenty-eight point haul against <a href="Newport%20RFC">Newport RFC</a> in the British & Irish Cup.
During the 2012/13 season, Carlisle went two better as he scored a sensational thirty points against Femi-CZ VEA Rovigo in the Amlin Challenge Cup.
With that total, he also became Warriors' highest ever individual points scorer in a European game, beating previous record holder's Shane Drahn who scored twenty-one points in 2008.
Predominantly a fly half, Carlisle can also play at centre.
In January 2013, it was announced that Carlisle will join <a href="Wasps%20RFC">Wasps</a> ahead of the 2013-14 season. After he left Wasps, Carlisle joined Italy region <a href="Benetton%20Rugby">Benetton Treviso</a>.
On 29 April 2015, Carlisle returns to England to join <a href="London%20Welsh">London Welsh</a> in the <a href="RFU%20Championship">RFU Championship</a> from the 2015-16 season.
On 29 Décember 2016, Joe move to <a href="USA%20Perpignan">USA Perpignan</a>, in France (Pro D2). Carlisle returned to England to join third division club <a href="Old%20Elthamians">Old Elthamians</a> in <a href="National%20League%201">National League 1</a> from the 2017-18 season.
On 16 September 2019, Carlisle returns to the <a href="RFU%20Championship">RFU Championship</a> with <a href="Yorkshire%20Carnegie">Yorkshire Carnegie</a> from the 2019-20 season.
